fields.name: amount
fields.title: Amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen (N) fertilizer which was applied to this crop as a treatment factor. This does not include N in FYM or castor bean meal. Note at different periods of the experiment N was variously applied in autumn or spring and applied in a single application or split applications. Timings and amounts of N applied are indicated in the yield_data table in the fields spring1_n_kg/ha, spring1_n_date, spring2_n_kg/ha, spring2_n_date, etc.

resources.name: yield_data

fields.name: harvest_year
fields.title: Year in which crop harvested
fields.description: Year in which the crop was harvested. It will generally have been sown the previous year, eg the 1968 crop was sown in autumn 1967.

fields.name: strip
fields.title: strip
fields.description: Treatment strips which extend the whole length of the field and receive the different fertilizer and manure treatments (1-22). There is no Strip 4. Current Strip 21 also known as 2.1, 2a or 2A, current Strip 22 also known as 2.2, 2b or 2B. Strip 1 (Sections 2-7) was started in 1968.

fields.name: section
fields.title: Section number 1968 onwards
fields.description: Since 1968 the treatment strips have been divided into 10 Sections (0-9) some in continuous wheat (0, 1, 6, 8 and 9) and some in rotation with non-wheat crops (2-5, 7, see previous crop).Herbicides have been used as required since 1964 on all of the experiment, except for Section 8 (old Section VA), which has never received herbicides. See plans for further details.

fields.name: plot
fields.title: plot
fields.description: Unique whole plot number, determined by Strip (1-22) and Section (0-9) number

fields.name: section_1926-67
fields.title: section 1926-1967
fields.description: Previous Section name, 1926-1967. Originally five Sections (I-V).  1926-1954, Section I divided into IA and IB in 1955, Section V divided in VA and VB in 1955.

fields.name: fertilizer_code
fields.title: fertilizer and manure treatment code
fields.description: Code describing the fertilizer or manure applied in that harvest year

fields.name: cropping
fields.title: cropping
fields.description: Cropping in that harvest year:  spring field beans 1968-1978; winter field beans 2018 onwards. See crop_types_data for more information.

fields.name: previous_crop
fields.title: previous crop
fields.description: Crop grown in previous harvest year: winter wheat, potatoes  or field beans. See crop_types_data for more information.

fields.name: fym_factor_level
fields.title: FYM factor level
fields.description: Code for the farmyard manure (FYM) factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fym_applied
fields.title: FYM applied
fields.description: Amount of farmyard manure (FYM) applied in that harvest year. Beans did not received FYM from 2018 onwards.

fields.name: fym_date
fields.title: Date FYM applied
fields.description: Date farmyard manure (FYM) applied, usually in the autumn. Not applied to beans from 2018 harvest year onwards.

fields.name: castor_meal_factor_level
fields.title: Castor meal factor level
fields.description: Code for the castor mean factor level applied in that harvest year. Before 1941 rape cake.

fields.name: castor_meal_n_applied
fields.title: Castor meal N applied
fields.description: Amount of N applied in the castor bean meal

fields.name: castor_meal_date
fields.title: Date castor meal applied
fields.description: Date castor bean meal applied, usually in the autumn

fields.name: n_factor_level
fields.title: N factor level
fields.description: Code for the inorganic nitrogen fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year. Beans did not receive fertilizer N from 2018 onwards.

fields.name: spring_n_kg/ha
fields.title: Spring fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Amount of N in application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM or castor meal. Beans did not received N from 2018 onwards.

fields.name: spring_n_date
fields.title: Spring fertilizer N date
fields.description: Date of application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring. Beans did not receive N from 2018 onwards.

fields.name: total_fertilizer_n_amount
fields.title: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in autumn and spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM or castor meal.

fields.name: p_factor_level
fields.title: P factor level
fields.description: Code for the phosphorous (P) fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: p_amount
fields.title: P amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic P fertilizer applied in that harvest year. This does not include P in FYM or castor bean meal.

fields.name: p_date
fields.title: P fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic P fertilizer applied in that harvest year.

fields.name: k_factor_level
fields.title: K factor level
fields.description: Code for the potassium (K) fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: k_amount
fields.title: K amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic K fertilizer applied in that harvest year. This does not include K in FYM or castor bean meal.

fields.name: k_date
fields.title: K fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic K fertilizer applied in that harvest year.

fields.name: na_factor_level
fields.title: Na factor level
fields.description: Code for the sodium (Na) fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: na_amount
fields.title: Na amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic Na fertilizer applied in that harvest year. This does not include Na in FYM or castor bean meal.

fields.name: na_date
fields.title: Na fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic Na fertilizer applied in that harvest year.

fields.name: mg_factor_level
fields.title: Mg factor level
fields.description: Code for the magnesium (Mg) fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: mg_amount
fields.title: Mg amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic Mg fertilizer applied in that harvest year. This does not include Mg in FYM or castor bean meal.

fields.name: mg_date
fields.title: Mg fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic Mg fertilizer applied in that harvest year.

fields.name: sow_date
fields.title: Sowing date
fields.description: Date the crop was sown. Spring beans sown in the spring of the harvest year, winter beans in the preceeding autumn.

fields.name: harvest_date
fields.title: Harvest date
fields.description: Date the crop was harvested

fields.name: cultivar
fields.title: Cultivar
fields.description: Crop cultivar or variety

fields.name: tgw
fields.title: Thousand grain weight
fields.description: The thousand grain weight of the bean grain. The weight in grams of 1000 bean kernels. It is determined using an automatic grain counter. Expressed at 100% dry matter. After counting, the grain is dried overnight at 105 degrees C. Beans are weighed in two batches of 100, the average is then multiplied by 10 to get a  weight per thousand grains. Data is not available for 1968-1973.

fields.name: grain
fields.title: Grain yield
fields.description: Harvested bean grain yield at 85% dry matter.

fields.name: straw
fields.title: Straw yield
fields.description: Harvested bean straw yield at 85% dry matter. Straw does not include stubble. Straw removed at harvest.

fields.name: note
fields.title: Note
fields.description: Whether notes are applied or not

resources.title: crop yield data
resources.description: The main data table containing annual field bean (Vicia faba) grain and straw yield data for all plots, and details of all fertilizer and manure treatments. Also thousand grain weights and other agronomic information, including sowing and harvest dates, amount, and bean cultivars. Field beans were grown as part of the arable rotation on Broadbalk in 1968-1978 (spring beans) and 2018-2022 (winter beans).  The Broadbalk Experiment was started in autumn 1843 to investigate the effects of fertilizers containing N, P, K, Na and Mg in various combinations, and organic manure, on the yield of winter wheat grown continuously. The treatment STRIPS (3-22) extend the whole length of the field; each strip tests a different fertilizer or manure treatment. In 1926 the strips were divided into five SECTIONS (I-V), bare fallowed in sequence to control weeds. There were further divisions in 1955 making seven Sections (IA-VB). In 1968 the strips were divided into 10 SECTIONS (0-9) and Strip 1 (Sections 2-7 only) was added.  Each PLOT is a unique strip\section combination. Sections 0, 1, 8 and 9 remained in continuous winter wheat. In Sections 2-7 wheat was grown rotation with other arable crops (beans, potatoes, oats or forage maize) and fallow.  Yields from wheat and other non-wheat crops are published separately. See notes and Broadbalk section names.pdf for full details of layout and the cropping plans for details of the different crop rotations.  Beans grown 1968-1978 received N, FYM and other fertilizers at the same rate as the winter wheat. Beans grown from 2018 onwards did not receive N or FYM, but received P, K and Mg at the same rate as the winter wheat. Bean straw was removed at harvest. Yields are shown at 85% dry matter.

name: broadbalk-field-bean-yield-components-1968-2022
title: Broadbalk field bean yield components 1968-2022
description: ### Abstract Annual field bean (Vicia faba) grain and straw yields for each treatment plot of the Broadbalk Experiment, with details of all fertilizer and manure applications. Also thousand grain weights (TGWs) and other agronomic information, including sowing and harvest dates, and bean cultivars. Field beans were grown as part of the arable rotation on Broadbalk in 1968-1978 (spring beans) and 2018-2022 (winter beans). ### Methods The Broadbalk Wheat Experiment was started in autumn 1843 to investigate the effects of fertilizers containing N, P, K, Na and Mg in various combinations, and organic manure, on the yield of winter wheat grown continuously. The treatment STRIPS (3-22) extend the whole length of the field; each strip tests a different fertilizer or manure treatment. In 1926 the strips were divided into five SECTIONS (I-V), bare fallowed in sequence to control weeds. There were further divisions in 1955 making seven Sections (IA-VB). Each PLOT is a unique strip\section combination. In 1968 the experiment was divided into ten Sections (0-9), to allow the comparison of wheat grown continuously with wheat in a three or five-year rotation. Sections 0, 1, 8 and 9 remained in continuous winter wheat. In Sections 2-7 wheat was grown in rotation with other arable crops (beans, potatoes, oats or forage maize) and fallow. In 1979 Section 6 reverted to continuous wheat. Strip 1 was added in 1968, on Sections 2-7 only. Yields from wheat and the other non-wheat crops are published separately. See section_names.pdf for full details of layout and the cropping plans for details of the different crop rotations. ### Technical Info Bean grain and straw yields are at 85% dry matter. Straw yield is that part of the straw cut by the combine harvester, and does not include the stubble or all of the chaff. Straw is removed at harvest. Spring beans grown 1968-1978 received N, FYM and other fertilizers at the same rate as the winter wheat. Winter beans grown from 2018 onwards did not receive N or FYM, but received P, K and Mg at the same rate as the winter wheat. TGWs calculated from two sub-samples of 100 bean grains, is the weight in grams of 1000 beans, expressed at 100% dry matter. Strip 21 was also known as 2.1, 2a and 2A; strip 22 was also known as 2.2, 2b and 2B. By convention, the year is that of harvest (not sowing). ### Other We thank the many other Rothamsted staff who have been involved in the production of this data, including farm staff, field recorders, laboratory staff and data recorders, too numerous to mention. ### Provenance Yields of grain and straw and TGWs are from the BKBEANS datasets in the e-RA database. Treatment details were taken from the Rothamsted Yield Books, published each year with details of each experiment. ### Quality In accordance with the Joint Code of Practice for Research at Rothamsted, data processing in e-RA follow rigorous standard operating procedures to ensure the quality and correctness of data collected in the field through to depositing in the e-RA database. To ensure quality control during data inputting, the data sets were typed on two separate occasions (double data entry). During the second typing (verification) the data values were compared with those typed on the earlier occasion, and any discrepancies were resolved before verification continued. This procedure also set out how to handle situations where the written records were illegible or ambiguous. This procedure avoided visual checking of data, which can be very inaccurate. Once the data were entered into e-RA, they were independently back-checked against the original data sheets.
